labels.text: Wang Guangyi’s composition reflects upon geopolitics and the challenges of travelling outside China in the early 1990s, a reference to his own uncomfortable experience of applying for visas to go abroad for his exhibitions during that time. Here, private information such as place and date of birth are scrawled openly across this portrait of an infant, an allusion to a lack of privacy and being marked at birth.

Wang Guangyi’s composition reflects upon geopolitics and the challenges of travelling outside China in the early 1990s, a reference to his own uncomfortable experience of applying for visas to go abroad for his exhibitions during that time. Here, private information such as place and date of birth are scrawled openly across a portrait of an infant, an allusion to a lack of privacy and being marked at birth.
由於申請簽證出席自己海外展覽的不愉快經歷，王廣義通過這幅作品展示了在1990年代初出境海外所遇到的地緣政治學挑戰。國家和出生日期等個人資料，都以潦草的字體直接寫在一幅嬰兒肖像上，暗指一種與生俱來的隱私缺失。
由於申請簽證出席自己海外展覽的不愉快經歷，王廣義通過這幅作品展示九十年代初的地緣政治環境和出境海外時遇到的困難。出生地和出生日期等個人資料，都以潦草的字體直接寫在一幅嬰兒肖像上，暗指隱私的缺失和與生俱來的不利情況。

images.AltText: Oil painting on canvas depicting a crying baby. Over the image a handwritten red flowchart leads from the header ‘Passport’ through the phrases ‘Name in full’, ‘sex’ and ‘Date of birth’ to the word ‘Visas’ which is highlighted at the bottom of the canvas.
images.AltTextTC: 油彩布本作品的主角，是一個哭泣的嬰兒。肖像上以人手寫上紅色流程圖，由畫面頂部的標題「護照」開始，在下方加添「全名」、「性別」和「出生日期」等字樣，直至畫面底部特別標示的「簽證」為止。
